Yes, there are many sustainable practices that restaurants are implementing in addition to composting to reduce their environmental impact. Here are a few examples:

1. Sourcing local and/or organic ingredients - Some restaurants prioritize purchasing locally sourced and/or organic ingredients to reduce their carbon footprint and support local farmers.

2. Eliminating single-use plastic - Many restaurants are phasing out single-use plastic items such as straws, lids, and utensils in favor of more sustainable options like reusable or compostable alternatives.

3. Installing energy-efficient equipment - Some restaurants are installing energy-efficient equipment like LED light bulbs, low-flow faucets, and Energy Star certified appliances to reduce their energy consumption and carbon emissions.

4. Donating excess food - Rather than throwing away excess food, some restaurants donate it to local food banks or other organizations that can distribute it to those in need.

5. Using eco-friendly cleaning products - Some restaurants are switching to eco-friendly cleaning products that are less harmful to the environment and less toxic for employees to use.

6. Offering plant-based options - Some restaurants are increasing their plant-based menu options to reduce their environmental impact associated with meat and dairy production.

7. Growing their own food - Some restaurants grow their own herbs, vegetables, and fruits in on-site gardens or rooftop farms to reduce transportation emissions and provide fresher ingredients for their dishes.

These are just a few examples of the many sustainable practices that restaurants can implement to reduce their environmental impact.
